summary: This bill, the National Infrastructure Investment Corporation Act of 2025, establishes a government corporation to provide loans, loan guarantees, and bonds for infrastructure projects. The corporation, managed by a board of directors, aims to finance projects beyond the capabilities of states and cities, prioritizing efficient project selection and minimizing federal costs. It outlines eligibility requirements for applicants, permitted uses of funds, and consultation with affected congressional members. The bill also details audit and reporting requirements, as well as provisions for funding through pension fund loans.
